root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Horticultural Peat (Prohibition of Sale): Ten Minute Rule Motion

MotionText.from_cdata: That leave be given to bring in a Bill to provide for the prohibition of the sale in England of horticultural peat by the end of 2024; to provide for certain exemptions from that prohibition; and for connected purposes.

from_cdata.p: The Member moving and a Member opposing this Motion may each speak for up to 10 minutes.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Tobacco and Vapes Bill: Second Reading

p.span: Oral evidence taken before the Health and Social Care Committee on 5 February and 6 February (Qq 391-412) 2024, on Prevention in health and social care, HC 141

MotionText.from_cdata: That the following provisions shall apply to the Tobacco and Vapes Bill: Committal (1) The Bill shall be committed to a Public Bill Committee. Proceedings in Public Bill Committee (2) Proceedings in the Public Bill Committee shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion on Thursday 23 May. (3) The Public Bill Committee shall have leave to sit twice on the first day on which it meets. Consideration and Third Reading (4) Proceedings on Consideration shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion one hour before the moment of interruption on the day on which those proceedings are commenced. (5) Proceedings on Third Reading shall (so far as not previously concluded) be brought to a conclusion at the moment of interruption on that day. (6) Standing Order No. 83B (Programming committees) shall not apply to proceedings on Consideration and Third Reading. Other proceedings (7) Any other proceedings on the Bill may be programmed.

That, for the purposes of any Act resulting from the Tobacco and Vapes Bill, it is expedient to authorise the payment out of money provided by Parliament of any increase attributable to the Act in the sums payable under any other Act out of money so provided.

root.BusinessItemHeadingNumbered: Tobacco and Vapes Bill: Ways and Means

MotionText.from_cdata: That, for the purposes of any Act resulting from the Tobacco and Vapes Bill, it is expedient to authorise the charging of fees under or by virtue of the Act.

root.DebateTimingRubric: No debate or decision (Standing Order No. 153)
root.MotionText: Recommendations of the Infected Blood Inquiry: Ian Lavery
root.DebateTimingRubric: Until 7.30pm or for half an hour (whichever is later) (Standing Order No. 9(7))
The first part of the sitting will last for two hours. The second part of the sitting will last for three hours (Standing Order No. 10(1)).
